intro: Lafoensia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican lafoensia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its bark is often fissured and may exude a milky sap, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Lafoensia mexicana is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in dry, rocky soils.
